Technique:
1. Start by sitting on the floor with legs extended
2. Cross legs comfortably in front of you
3. Keep head, neck and spine aligned straight
4. Rest hands on knees
5. Form Bindu mudra with index finger and thumb together
Areas Stretched:
Hip flexors
Inner thighs (adductors)
Outer hips
Areas Engaged:
Lower back
Core (for posture)
Upper back muscles
Practice Tips:
• If hips are tight, sit on a folded blanket or block
• Keep shoulders relaxed away from ears
• If knees are higher than hips, use additional support
• Stack head over heart, heart over pelvis
• Alternate which leg is in front to balance hips
Benefits:
• Promotes mental calmness
• Establishes meditation posture
• Brings steadiness and comfort

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): 
Verse Translation:

Technique:
1. Begin in Padmasana with feet on opposite thighs
2. Ground sitting bones firmly
3. Inhale, raise arms overhead near ears
4. Bring palms together in Anjali mudra
5. Keep spine straight and chest lifted
6. Maintain length through side body
Areas Stretched:
Intercostal muscles
Chest
Shoulders
Latissimus dorsi
Side body
Areas Engaged:
Core muscles
Spinal erectors
Shoulder stabilizers
Serratus anterior
Practice Tips:
• Keep shoulders down while lifting arms
• Maintain length in side body
• Press sitting bones firmly down
• Keep chin slightly tucked
• If shoulders tight, keep hands wider
• Focus on lifting through side ribs
Benefits:
• Purifies lungs, spleen, urinary bladder and diaphragm
• Creates expansion in lungs and diaphragm
• Provides grounding while energy lifts upward
Sanskrit Verse: अथ वक्ष्ये महादेव पर्वतासनमङ्गलम् । यत् कृत्वा स्थिररूपी स्यात् षट्चक्रादिविलोपनम् ॥२३.५२॥
Translation: O Mahādeva! now I shall talk about auspicious parvatāsana; Practising which (mental) stability is gained, and the penetration of the six cakras is called parvatāsana.

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/c1/02/79/c102790837fed0f6b1ab1b9afe026101.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit with legs extended in front
2. Bring soles of feet together
3. Exhale forward to touch forehead to heels
4. Interlace fingers behind back
5. Gaze at nose
Areas Stretched:
Hip flexors
Hamstrings
Lower back
Groin muscles
Spinal extensors
Areas Engaged:
Core stabilizers
Quadriceps
Erector spinae
Pelvic floor
Shoulders
Practice Tips:
• Keep feet actively flexed
• Maintain length in spine while folding
• If tight hamstrings, bend knees slightly
• Keep shoulders away from ears
• Press sitting bones firmly into ground
• Engage core to protect lower back
• Breathe deeply into the fold
Benefits:
• Purifies the body
• Facilitates kapalabhati
• Makes one Dheera (conquers inner world)
• Opens hip joints
• Stretches entire back body
• Calms nervous system
Sanskrit Verse: पूर्व विधि याहुँ में जानौ उभै पगथली संपुट ठानो । पिष्ट पछै दोउ कर ल्यावो दछिण कर सो वाम गहावो ॥ पिष्टि हथेल्यां की हए जोई अंसु सहित भूमि धरै सोई । पुनि ललाटि भूपरि ठाने एडयां लगता माहि आनें ॥
Translation: First know the method: bring both soles together in a vessel-like formation. Then bring both hands behind, right hand holding the left. Place the palms on the ground with the shoulders, then bring the forehead to the ground near the ankles. One who conquers this posture becomes a Dheera (master of the inner world).

Technique:
1. Inhale rising up
2. Bring soles together by body
3. Elbows on legs
4. Cup palms on floor
5. Gaze at nose

Inner thighs
Groin
Hip flexors
Lower back
Hamstrings
Areas Engaged:
Core muscles
Spinal extensors
Shoulder stabilizers
Pelvic floor
Quadriceps

• Keep spine long as you fold forward
• Press elbows gently into thighs
• Ground sitting bones evenly
• Keep feet actively flexed
• Maintain natural curve in lower back
• Engage core for stability
• Breathe deeply into the sides of the body
Benefits:
• Relieves tension in hips
• Improves spinal flexibility
• Calms nervous system
• Stimulates digestive organs
• Enhances concentration
Sanskrit Verse: पूरब विधि परि आगानै नीचौ हौई कल्हूणी फणा स्यौ लगाई हाथ आगानै धरती लगावै पसारि दोऊ हाथ की अञ्जुली करै भूयड़ी परि लगावै दृष्टि नासा अग्र आसण कौ गुण सरिर बथा जाई
Translation: Sit on the ground with legs extended in front. Bring both soles together keeping knees sidewards on the ground. Bend the head forward, place elbows on legs and extend hands on ground. Form a hollow of hands. Direct the gaze at the tip of nose. This asana removes bodily pains and brings steadiness to the spine.

Sanskrit Verse: अथान्यदासनं वक्ष्ये येन सिद्धो भवेन्नरः । अकस्माद्वायुसञ्चारं कोकिलाख्यासनेन च ॥२३.१०१॥ ऊद्धर्वे हस्तद्वयं कृत्वा तदग्रे पादयो सुधीः । वृद्धाङ्गुष्ठद्वयं नाथ शनैः शनैः प्रकारयेत्॥२३.१०२॥
Translation: Now I shall talk about another āsana by which one becomes a siddha; That is called kokilāsana by which the breath gets circulated instantly. O Lord! raise both hands and stretch both legs upwards; And hold both the big toes, do this in a slow process. Then perform padmāsana properly by contracting and resting over the knee-joints.

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): अथान्यदासनं वक्ष्ये येन सिद्धो भवेन्नरः । अकस्माद्वायुसञ्चारं कोकिलाख्यासनेन च ॥२३.१०१॥ ऊद्धर्वे हस्तद्वयं कृत्वा तदग्रे पादयो सुधीः । वृद्धाङ्गुष्ठद्वयं नाथ शनैः शनैः प्रकारयेत्॥२३.१०२॥
Verse Translation: Now I shall talk about another āsana by which one becomes a siddha; That is called kokilāsana by which the breath gets circulated instantly. O Lord! raise both hands and stretch both legs upwards; And hold both the big toes, do this in a slow process. Then perform padmāsana properly by contracting and resting over the knee-joints.

Sanskrit Verse: गोडा बांवा पाद की आष मांहिली सोय । दछि चरन को वारिलौ ता परि गुलफ समोय ॥ वामपाद को माहि लौ बहुरो गुलफ जु जान । ता परि गोडा दछि की आँष बारिली ठान ॥ बहुरि भुजा दोउ कर की जोउ कहुण्या लगति प्रकारो सोउ ॥ भुजपसारि अधर करि राखै नासादृष्टि वचन नहि भाषै ॥
Translation: Cross left knee above right ankle and left ankle below right knee, catch hold of two arms with hands and then extending the arms in front, churn it clockwise and counterclockwise observing silence. Gaze at the tip of nose. It purifies the body, removes physical disorders, and brings lightness to body. The nadis are purified, churning the pranavayu.

Sanskrit Verse: न्युब्जं पादाग्रे भूमौकृत्वा लम्बीभूय मस्तकाग्रे निधाय नितम्बं ऊर्ध्व मुत्रमय्य नाभिलक्ष्यं भूमौ नासिकामानिय हस्ततलपर्यन्त नयेत् इत्थं पुनः पुनः कुर्यात् गजासनं भवति ॥ २५ ॥
Translation: Being prone place the soles on the ground (i.e. Bending forwards and lengthening the body keep both hands over the head and raise the hip upwards), then bring the nose near the ground which is at the level of the naval and then extend the nose up to the hands. Do in this way again and again. This is called Gajasana. Like an elephant's trunk, move the nose in circles while maintaining the pose.

Sanskrit Verse: एकैकम् पादमाकुञ्च्य गजासनम् कुर्यात् ऋक्षासनम् भवति ॥२७॥
Translation: Assuming the position of Gajasana keep contracting the feet one by one (left foot and right foot alternatively pressing to floor). This is Rksasana. Like a bear's steady stance, maintain stability while alternating the heel press.

Translation: Keeping one knee against the chest continue to stay embracing it. This asana is called Balalingasana as it resembles the embrace of a child. The practitioner should maintain steadiness while holding the pose with care and attention, like holding a precious child.

Sanskrit Verse: कम्पनं शरीरस्य भूत्वा तीव्रं प्रचालयेत् । विश्राम्य शक्तिं प्राप्नोति ज्वलनं परमात्मनि ॥
Translation: Integrity is stored in your bone structure. The strength of your bone structure is the strength of your integrity. Through intense shaking of the body and then resting, one attains the power of the supreme Self burning within.

Sanskrit Verse: गजासन विस्थित्वा मस्तकं वारं वारं दक्षिणकुक्षिम् सव्यकुक्षिम् नयेत् तरक्ष्वासनं भवति ॥ २६ ॥

Sanskrit Verse: अङ्गुष्ठ नाभिपर्यन्तमधोभूमौ विनिन्यसेत् करभ्यां च धरां धृत्वा ऊर्ध्व शीर्षः फणीव हि ॥ ४१ ॥ देहाग्निवर्धते नित्यं सर्वरोगविनाशनम् जागर्ति भुजगी देवी भुजङ्गासनसाधनात् ॥ ४२ ॥
Translation: Keep the body from the toes to the navel on the floor and placing the palms of the hands firmly on the floor, raise the head like a snake. The fire of the body increases, all diseases are destroyed and kundalini Shakti is awakened by the practice of bhujangasana.

Sanskrit Verse: उभै पगथलि सम ठहरावे तिन कौ माहिली कोर मिलावे । फणा पाणि उकड होय वसे एडी दोउ जोनि निवसे ॥ गोडा दोउ भूमि लगावे सम सरीर नीका ठहरावे ॥
Translation: Join the soles together, balancing on toes, sit on heels pressing perineum. Let the knees touch the ground, balancing the body, place both palms on respective knees. Like the great sage Kapila, maintain perfect steadiness and focus.

Sanskrit Verse: दोऊ पगथली संपुट करै कोर वारिली भूपरि धरै। कोर वारिली राखे ऐसै तापरि मूलद्वारि टिकि बैसै॥१३१॥ गोडा पीडी भूवपरि दाखै हाथ दोऊ गोडा परि राखै। दृष्टि त्रिकुटी मध्य जु ठानै ताकौ गोरखभद्र खानै॥१३२॥ या आसन के कीयेते सकल रोग छय होय। फुन जोगी को जयत कहै खेद न उपजै कोय॥१३३॥
Translation: Join both soles together and place them on the ground. Position the soles such that the arms rest upon the toes. Place the knees on the ground with hands upon them respectively. Fix the gaze between the eyebrows - this is called Gorakhabhadra. By practicing this asana, all diseases are destroyed and the yogi becomes free from all dejection.

Sanskrit Verse: एडी दोउ गुदा तरि आनै फणा पाणि बैठक पुनि ठानै। गोडा जंघ अधर करि रहै आडे बाम इसी विधि गहै॥८१॥ दोउ भुजा नभ दिसा पसारै कमल स्वरूप अंगुरि धारै। पौहचा मधि छिद्र पुनि ठानै छिद्र विषै पुनि दृष्टि जु आनै॥८२॥ अग्नि वृद्धि अतिसै करै रोगनास सब होय। उदर उलटि संकोचिये सूर्यासन सोय॥८३॥
Translation: Place both heels beneath the anus; raise up on the toes and establish the sitting position. Keep the knees and thighs lifted, crossed in this manner. Extend both arms toward the sky forming a lotus with the fingers. Create a space at the center of the palms and fix the gaze there. This greatly increases the digestive fire and destroys all diseases. Pull in and contract the abdomen - this is Surya Asana.

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): एडी दोउ गुदा तरि आनै फणा पाणि बैठक पुनि ठानै। गोडा जंघ अधर करि रहै आडे बाम इसी विधि गहै॥८१॥ दोउ भुजा नभ दिसा पसारै कमल स्वरूप अंगुरि धारै। पौहचा मधि छिद्र पुनि ठानै छिद्र विषै पुनि दृष्टि जु आनै॥८२॥ अग्नि वृद्धि अतिसै करै रोगनास सब होय। उदर उलटि संकोचिये सूर्यासन सोय॥८३॥
Verse Translation: Place both heels beneath the anus; raise up on the toes and establish the sitting position. Keep the knees and thighs lifted, crossed in this manner. Extend both arms toward the sky forming a lotus with the fingers. Create a space at the center of the palms and fix the gaze there. This greatly increases the digestive fire and destroys all diseases. Pull in and contract the abdomen - this is Surya Asana.

Translation: Place both feet at the back with the toes touching each other. Bringing both knees forward, practice Mandukasana in this way. [Like a frog seated quietly, this posture should be maintained.].

Sanskrit Verse: दक्षिणं सव्यगुल्फेन दक्षिणेन तथेतरम्। हस्तौ च जान्वोः संस्थाप्य स्वाङ्गुलीश्च प्रसार्य च॥५॥ व्यात्तवक्त्रो निरीक्षेत नासाग्रं सुसमाहितः। सिंहासनं भवेदेतत् पूजितं योगिभिः सदा॥६॥
Translation: Press the right ankle with the left heel and the left ankle with the right heel. Place both hands on the knees with fingers spread wide. Open the mouth wide and gaze steadily at the tip of the nose. This is Simhasana, always revered by yogis.[The position embodies the fierce aspect of a lion.]

Sanskrit Verse: गुल्फौ च वृषणस्याधो व्युत्क्रमेण समाहितः। पादाङ्गुष्ठौ कराभ्यां च धृत्वा च पृष्ठदेशतः॥९॥ जालन्धरं समासाद्य नासाग्रमवलोकयेत्। भद्रासनं भवेदेतत् सर्वव्याधिविनाशकम्॥१०॥
Translation: Place both ankles beneath the testicles in reverse order. Hold both big toes with the hands behind the back. Applying Jalandhara Bandha, gaze at the tip of the nose. This is Bhadrasana, which destroys all diseases. [The word 'Bhadra' means auspicious, indicating the beneficial nature of this pose.]

Sanskrit Verse: प्रथमे वैसक उकड ठानै दोउ हाथ पगां व्यचि आनै। तिन को मोडि नल्यां परि ल्यवै पिष्टि पछै कांकसी करवै॥३२८॥ या आसन के कीये ते दीरघु जुर सब जाय। जैतराम यो कीजियै नासादृष्टि लगाय॥३२९॥
Translation: First assume squatting position. Bring both hands between the legs, threading them through. Turn them back to form a finger lock behind. This relieves chronic fever when practiced with gaze fixed at the tip of the nose.[Named after the enlightened crow Kakabhusandi from ancient texts.

Sanskrit Verse: सीस सीषा धरती टेकी पग दोऊ मिलिवा ऊंचा कु करै। पगथली आकास दिशि सनमुष राशै दोऊ हाथा की हथेली दोऊ पाषत्या। धरती टेकौ दृष्टि नासाअग्र आसण कौगुण रहै कपाली आसन जाम। सेतबाल होई अवे श्याम ओरसो लज्ञान जाणै साच मान बहु बेद। बषानै सिरतरि करि पग ऊंचा धरै पहलौ छिन अभ्यासह करै। दिन तै संधि साधौं आगै तीनमासमै जुगली भागै॥
Translation: Place the head and both hands on the ground, stretching both legs upward. The feet should point toward the sky, palms pressing the earth. Fix the gaze at the tip of the nose. Through practice of Kapali asana, grey hair turns black. With 3 hours practice, one gains knowledge of time. With 3 months practice, aging is overcom.

Sanskrit Verse: मयूरं दण्डवत्कुर्यान्मायूरं दण्डनामकम्। कुर्यान्मायूरं पार्श्वाभ्यां मायूरपार्श्वनामकम्॥४४॥
Translation: When Mayurasana is practiced straight like a staff, it is called Danda Mayura. When practiced sideways on both sides, it becomes Parsva Mayura. [The posture embodies the graceful strength of a peacock.]

Sanskrit Verse: भून्यस्तौ जानुनी हस्तौ चतुष्पदमवाङ्मुखम्। उत्थापिताङ्घ्रियुगलकटिस्थलमभिरुका॥

• Increases focus
Sanskrit Verse: दोउ करकी उभै हथेली कोर वारिली मैले भेली। सो आगांनै भूपरि दाखै माहांनै अंगुली मिलि राखै॥२८३॥ अंगुष्ठ छीदा राखै दोई पुनह हथेली पिष्टि जु जोई। ता परि मूल द्वारि टिक वैसे बहुरय्यो जुगति करै एक वैसे॥२८४॥ कुहुण्यां महिली आषि मिलावै हाथ उद्रसौ लग्या रहावै। बहुरो लांवा पाव पसारे फणा उर्ध्व एडी भू धारे॥२८५॥ अंगुष्ठ अवर गुलफ माहिला राखै जुड्या करै नही षुला। साधै नासा दृष्टि लागाई ता को रस रोग सबजाई॥२८६॥
Translation: Place both palms face up on the ground at the sides. Keep fingers straight and together, backs of hands near perineum. Let hands touch the sides of abdomen. Extend legs forward with toes pointing up and heels grounded. Keep heels and toes together, gaze at the nose. This removes harsa diseases [nervous disorders].

Sanskrit Verse: जानूपरि ललाटं तु पश्चिमं ताणमुच्यते। येन केन प्रकारेण सुखं धार्यं च जायते॥५०॥
Translation: Placing the forehead upon the knees is called the Western Stretch (Paschimatana). By whatever means it is achieved, it should be held comfortably. This posture causes prana to flow through sushumna, increases digestive fire, reduces belly fat, and brings overall health.

Sanskrit Verse: स्वपाणिभ्यां दृढं धृत्वा जानूपरि शिरो न्यसेत्॥ आसनोग्रमिदं प्रोक्तं भवेदनिलदीपनम्। देहावसानहरणं पश्चिमोत्तानसंज्ञकम्॥ य एतदासनं श्रेष्ठं प्रत्यहं साध्येत्सुधीः। वायुः पश्चिममार्गेन तस्य संचरति ध्रुवम्॥९२॥ एतदभ्यासशीलानां सर्वसिद्धिः प्रजायते। तस्माद्योगी प्रयत्नेन साधयेत्सिद्धमात्मनः॥९३॥ गोपनीयं प्रयत्नेन न यस्य कस्यचित्। येन शीघ्रं मरुत्सिद्धिर्भवेद् दुःखौघनाशिनी॥९४॥
Translation: Firmly grasp with both hands and place the head on the knees. This fierce posture is proclaimed to kindle the digestive fire. Called the Western Raised pose, it wards off death. The wise one who practices this excellent asana daily surely causes the vital air to move through the western path. All siddhis arise for those dedicated to its practice. Therefore the yogi should attain perfection through determined effort. This should be carefully kept secret, not given to just anyone, for through it vayu-siddhi is quickly attained, destroying hosts of miseries.

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): स्वपाणिभ्यां दृढं धृत्वा जानूपरि शिरो न्यसेत्॥ आसनोग्रमिदं प्रोक्तं भवेदनिलदीपनम्। देहावसानहरणं पश्चिमोत्तानसंज्ञकम्॥ य एतदासनं श्रेष्ठं प्रत्यहं साध्येत्सुधीः। वायुः पश्चिममार्गेन तस्य संचरति ध्रुवम्॥९२॥ एतदभ्यासशीलानां सर्वसिद्धिः प्रजायते। तस्माद्योगी प्रयत्नेन साधयेत्सिद्धमात्मनः॥९३॥ गोपनीयं प्रयत्नेन न यस्य कस्यचित्। येन शीघ्रं मरुत्सिद्धिर्भवेद् दुःखौघनाशिनी॥९४॥
Verse Translation: Firmly grasp with both hands and place the head on the knees. This fierce posture is proclaimed to kindle the digestive fire. Called the Western Raised pose, it wards off death. The wise one who practices this excellent asana daily surely causes the vital air to move through the western path. All siddhis arise for those dedicated to its practice. Therefore the yogi should attain perfection through determined effort. This should be carefully kept secret, not given to just anyone, for through it vayu-siddhi is quickly attained, destroying hosts of miseries.

Asana Name: Ugrasana

3. Interlace fingers behind head
4. Exhale leaning chest forward
5. Head towards knees

Sanskrit Verse: गुल्फौ तु वृषणस्याधः सीवन्याः पार्श्वयोः क्षिपेत्। पादपार्श्वे तु पाणिभ्यां दृढं बद्ध्वा सुनिश्चलम्। भद्रासनं भवेदेतत् सर्वव्याधिविषापहम्॥

Technique: 1. Keep one knee & leg flat on floor
2. Raise seat up, place perineum above heel
3. Opposite knee raised with foot on other sole
4. Interlace fingers behind neck
5. Bring elbows together outside raised knee
Areas Streached: Hip rotators
Spine
Shoulders
Neck
Areas Engaged: Core muscles
Hip stabilizers
Spinal rotators
Practice Tips: • Keep spine tall
• Ground sitting bone
• Twist from base
• Keep shoulders relaxed
• Breathe into twist
Pranamaya: Sitkari
Bandha: Mula
Mudra: Parushu
Visualization: Sage Narada
Gaze: Third eye
Japa: MahaNithyanandoham
Benefits: • Tones spine
• Improves digestion
• Purifies nadis
Pramana Source: Jogapradipyaka 298-302
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): पिष्टि जु वाम पगथलि केरी भूपरि ताहि लगावे फेरी। गोडा सुधौ फणौ है जोई दछि पाखति राखै सोई॥
Verse Translation: Left foot flat, right knee raised, elbows outside raised knee, fingers interlaced behind neck.
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/31/19/f7/3119f7024998c7c16010d960266b90b5.jpg
Goal Tags: strength; muscle toning; back pain relief; digestion

Technique:
1. Lower foot to thigh of raised knee
2. Wrap arm around legs
3. Hold opposite shin
4. Extend hand down towards feet
5. Hold big toe with index & middle finger
Areas Engaged:
Core muscles
Spinal stabilizers
Arm muscles
Practice Tips:
• Keep spine tall
• Maintain steady breath
• Ground sitting bones
• Engage core
• Release shoulder tension
Benefits:
• Opens hips
• Improves flexibility
• Calms mind

3. Bring gaze to nose
4. Keep spine straight
Areas Engaged:
Core muscles
Spinal erectors
Pelvic floor
Practice Tips:
• Enter pose gradually
• Keep spine tall
• Ground sitting bones
• Relax shoulders
• Breathe steadily
Benefits:
• Calms mind
• Steadies breath
• Prepares for meditation
Benefits in Paragraph:
Enhances Flexibility: Padmasana significantly opens the hips and stretches the knees and ankles, allowing for greater mobility and flexibility within the body.

  Calms the Mind: This sacred posture fosters a state of inner tranquility, facilitating deep breathing and meditation, which ultimately reduces stress and cultivates peace within.

 Improves Posture: By strengthening the spine, Padmasana aids in maintaining an upright posture, aligning the body in harmony with spiritual energy flow.
It reduces Reactionary assumptions
Sanskrit Verse: आसनं द्विविधं प्रोक्तं पद्मं वज्रासनं तथा॥४॥ ऊर्ध्वोरुपरि चेद्धत्ते उभे पादतले यथा। पद्मासनं भवेदेतत् सर्वपापप्रणाशनम्॥५॥
Translation: Postures are of two kinds: Padmasana and Vajrasana. When one places the soles of feet over the two thighs crosswise, this becomes Padma posture, which destroys all sin.

Sanskrit Verse: उत्तानशयनं कूर्पराभ्यां भूमिमवष्टभ्यहस्तौ नितंबं निधाय शिरः ऊरु जंघापादान् दंडवत् धारयेत् नौकासनमं भवति
Translation: Lying supine, hold the ground with the elbows and keep the two hands on the hips. Then keep up the head, the thigh, the shank and the feet like a stick. This is called Naukasana [resembling the shape of a boat with two ends raised high].

Sanskrit Verse: पगथलि संपुट करि हाथ स्यौ पग उचाई पगाका अगुठा दोउ लेऊ परली कानी तालवै पछै दोउ हाथ पगामाहे करि नीचै करि चीरै आणि पगाकी आगल्या पर कांकसी दृष्टि नासा अग्र आसन कौगुन ऊद्र बिषै कही भाति कौ रोग होई यदि यहु आसण कही आगानै सोवै जैअवरजाई गारोगपीडा होईतौ यहु आसण करि मूलद्वार टेकि धरति ज्स्यौबैसै जैरोगन होई तौ सुडछा आसन करी बौ करै
Translation: First thread both hands through the legs, hold the feet, and bring them towards the chest. Keep the spine straight, gaze fixed at the tip of the nose, and maintain steady breathing. This asana removes diseases, particularly those of the digestive system.

Sanskrit Verse: ऊर्ध्वे च जानुनी कृत्वा शवितोर्ध्वमुखं तथा । उत्थाप्य हस्तौ तिष्ठेत्तु पीठ उन्मुखनामके । भून्यस्तौ जानुनी हस्तौ चतुष्पदमवाङ्मुखम् । उत्थापिताङ्घ्रियुगलकटिस्थलमभिरुका ॥
Translation: Lying supine, bend the knees and place feet on the ground. Raise the hips, support with hands, and lift the chest upward. This pose was developed by Gargi for pregnant women. It overcomes weakness and offers strength. Keep the chin tucked in Jalandhara bandha and maintain steady breath.

Sanskrit Verse: उत्तानं शववद्भूमौ शयनं तत्तु शवासनम् । शवासनं श्रान्तिहरं चित्तविश्रान्तिकारकम् ॥ अथवा पद्मासनस्थो समासीनः सुखेन च । समग्रीवशिरःकायः सन्निरीक्ष्येकलक्ष्यकः ॥ सर्वचिन्ताविनिर्मुक्तः सजीवन्मुक्तलक्षणम् । इदं तु शाम्भवी मुद्रा सर्वतन्त्रेषु गोपिता ॥
Translation: Lie supine on the ground motionless like a corpse. This is Shavasana, which removes fatigue and gives rest to the mind. One may also sit in Padmasana comfortably, keeping the head, neck and body straight, gazing at a single point, free from all thoughts. This is the mark of one liberated while living. This is the Shambhavi mudra, kept secret in all tantras.
